item.title: Using CNNs to Alleviate Local Traffic
item.description: The 4th Ave Train Spotter is a piece of technology I helped develop with the good people at Cohub, a software company based out of Nashville, TN. My dad, Steve, and brother, Elliott, both help run the company. Cohub’s office is located in the Wedgewood-Houston neighborhood of Nashville, where railroad tracks cross over two roads, 4th Avenue and Chestnut Street. The trains passing through can be quick, or they can take their time.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to my personal website! I’m Hayden Roche, a technologist based out of Chicago, IL. In September 2019, I left my job as a hardware/FPGA engineer at a high frequency trading firm and am currently studying computer vision and machine learning while I wait out a one year non-compete agreement. On this site, you’ll find guides and posts on various topics, including Linux (I’m an Ubuntu user) and my computer vision and ML journey.
